t: Mark 10
Marriage and Divorce
Then*p He arose from there and came to the region of Judea by the other side of the Jordan. And multitudes gathered to Him again, and as He was accustomed, He taught them again.
The*p Pharisees came and asked Him, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his*i wife?” testing Him.
And*p He answered and said to them, “What*r did*r Moses*r command*r you?”*r
They*p said, “Moses permitted a*i man*i to write a certificate of divorce, and to dismiss her.”*i
And*p Jesus answered and said to them, “Because*r of*r the*r hardness*r of*r your*r heart*r he*r wrote*r you*r this*r precept.*r
But*r from*r the*r beginning*r of*r the*r creation,*r God*r ‘made*r them*r male*r and*r female.’*r
‘For*r this*r reason*r a*r man*r shall*r leave*r his*r father*r and*r mother*r and*r be*r joined*r to*r his*r wife,*r
and*r the*r two*r shall*r become*r one*r flesh’;*r so*r then*r they*r are*r no*r longer*r two,*r but*r one*r flesh.*r
Therefore*r what*r God*r has*r joined*r together,*r let*r not*r man*r separate.”*r
In*p the house His disciples also asked Him again about the same matter.*i
So He said to them, “Whoever*r divorces*r his*r wife*r and*r marries*r another*r commits*r adultery*r against*r her.*r
And*r if*r a*r woman*r divorces*r her*r husband*r and*r marries*r another,*r she*r commits*r adultery.”*r
Jesus Blesses Little Children
Then*p they brought little children to Him, that He might touch them; but the disciples rebuked those who brought them.*i

But when Jesus saw it,*i He was greatly displeased and said to them, “Let*r the*r little*r children*r come*r to*r Me,*r and*r do*r not*r forbid*r them;*r for*r of*r such*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r whoever*r does*r not*r receive*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r as*r a*r little*r child*r will*r by*r no*r means*r enter*r it.”*r
And He took them up in His arms, laid His*i hands on them, and blessed them.
Jesus Counsels the Rich Young Ruler
Now*p as He was going out on the road, one came running, knelt before Him, and asked Him, “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?”
So*p Jesus said to him, “Why*r do*r you*r call*r Me*r good?*r No*r one*r is*ir good*r but*r One,*r that*ir is,*ir God.*r

You*r know*r the*r commandments:*r ‘Do*r not*r commit*r adultery,’*r ‘Do*r not*r murder,’*r ‘Do*r not*r steal,’*r ‘Do*r not*r bear*r false*r witness,’*r ‘Do*r not*r defraud,’*r ‘Honor*r your*r father*r and*r your*r mother.’”*r
And*p he answered and said to Him, “Teacher, all these things I have kept from my youth.”

Then*p Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, “One*r thing*r you*r lack:*r Go*r your*r way,*r sell*r whatever*r you*r have*r and*r give*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r you*r will*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven;*r and*r come,*r take*r up*r the*r cross,*r and*r follow*r Me.”*r
But*p he was sad at this word, and went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.
With God All Things Are Possible
Then*p Jesus looked around and said to His disciples, “How*r hard*r it*r is*r for*r those*r who*r have*r riches*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!”*r

And the disciples were astonished at His words. But Jesus answered again and said to them, “Children,*r how*r hard*r it*r is*r for*r those*r who*r trust*r in*r riches*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r
It*r is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r the*r eye*r of*r a*r needle*r than*r for*r a*r rich*r man*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
And*p they were greatly astonished, saying among themselves, “Who then can be saved?”
But*p Jesus looked at them and said, “With*r men*r it*ir is*ir impossible,*r but*r not*r with*r God;*r for*r with*r God*r all*r things*r are*r possible.”*r
Then*p Peter began to say to Him, “See, we have left all and followed You.”

So*p Jesus answered and said, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r there*r is*r no*r one*r who*r has*r left*r house*r or*r brothers*r or*r sisters*r or*r father*r or*r mother*r or*r wife*r or*r children*r or*r lands,*r for*r My*r sake*r and*r the*r gospel’s,*r

who*r shall*r not*r receive*r a*r hundredfold*r now*r in*r this*r time—houses*r and*r brothers*r and*r sisters*r and*r mothers*r and*r children*r and*r lands,*r with*r persecutions—and*r in*r the*r age*r to*r come,*r eternal*r life.*r
But*r many*r who*ir are*ir first*r will*r be*r last,*r and*r the*r last*r first.”*r
Jesus a Third Time Predicts His Death and Resurrection

Now*p they were on the road, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going before them; and they were amazed. And as they followed they were afraid. Then He took the twelve aside again and began to tell them the things that would happen to Him:

“Behold,*r we*r are*r going*r up*r to*r Jerusalem,*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r betrayed*r to*r the*r chief*r priests*r and*r to*r the*r scribes;*r and*r they*r will*r condemn*r Him*r to*r death*r and*r deliver*r Him*r to*r the*r Gentiles;*r
and*r they*r will*r mock*r Him,*r and*r scourge*r Him,*r and*r spit*r on*r Him,*r and*r kill*r Him.*r And*r the*r third*r day*r He*r will*r rise*r again.”*r
Greatness Is Serving
Then*p James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Him, saying, “Teacher, we want You to do for us whatever we ask.”
And*p He said to them, “What*r do*r you*r want*r Me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r
They*p said to Him, “Grant us that we may sit, one on Your right hand and the other on Your left, in Your glory.”

But*p Jesus said to them, “You*r do*r not*r know*r what*r you*r ask.*r Are*r you*r able*r to*r drink*r the*r cup*r that*r I*r drink,*r and*r be*r baptized*r with*r the*r baptism*r that*r I*r am*r baptized*r with?”*r

They*p said to Him, “We are able.” So*p Jesus said to them, “You*r will*r indeed*r drink*r the*r cup*r that*r I*r drink,*r and*r with*r the*r baptism*r I*r am*r baptized*r with*r you*r will*r be*r baptized;*r
but*r to*r sit*r on*r My*r right*r hand*r and*r on*r My*r left*r is*r not*r Mine*r to*r give,*r but*r it*ir is*ir for*ir those*ir for*r whom*r it*r is*r prepared.”*r
And*p when the ten heard it,*i they began to be greatly displeased with James and John.

But Jesus called them to Himself*i and said to them, “You*r know*r that*r those*r who*r are*r considered*r rulers*r over*r the*r Gentiles*r lord*r it*r over*r them,*r and*r their*r great*r ones*r exercise*r authority*r over*r them.*r
Yet*r it*r shall*r not*r be*r so*r among*r you;*r but*r whoever*r desires*r to*r become*r great*r among*r you*r shall*r be*r your*r servant.*r
And*r whoever*r of*r you*r desires*r to*r be*r first*r shall*r be*r slave*r of*r all.*r
For*r even*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r did*r not*r come*r to*r be*r served,*r but*r to*r serve,*r and*r to*r give*r His*r life*r a*r ransom*r for*r many.”*r
Jesus Heals Blind Bartimaeus
Now*p they came to Jericho. As He went out of Jericho with His disciples and a great multitude, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the road begging.
And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out and say, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Then*p many warned him to be quiet; but he cried out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
So*p Jesus stood still and commanded him to be called. Then*p they called the blind man, saying to him, “Be of good cheer. Rise, He is calling you.”
And*p throwing aside his garment, he rose and came to Jesus.
So*p Jesus answered and said to him, “What*r do*r you*r want*r Me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r The*p blind man said to Him, “Rabboni, that I may receive my sight.”
Then*p Jesus said to him, “Go*r your*r way;*r your*r faith*r has*r made*r you*r well.”*r And immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus on the road.
